title: Shareholders Push Broad Array of ESG Proposals
sub_head: Proxy battles include efforts to get companies to give all employees sick leave, and to provide more transparency on carbon emissions
body:
Some shareholders want banks to stop financing new fossil-fuel projects. Others are asking companies to extend paid sick leave to cover part-time employees. And many are pressing businesses to go beyond lofty-sounding commitments to environmental, social and governance issues and explain how their business practices are delivering on carbon emissions, racial justice and more.
Welcome to what appears likely to be one of the most significant years ever for ESG shareholder proposals.
